alert.note: Alert for Northern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 29 at 3:45PM EST until January 30 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and very cold wind chills, with areas of blowing and drifting snow and poor visibility. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 11 inches for a storm total of 6 to 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Piscataquis County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 7 AM EST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM EST Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel extremely dangerous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
